title: Apple to unveil new iPhones with AI twist: what to expect
description: Apple's ubiquitous iPhone is about to break new ground with a shift into artificial intelligence that will do everything from smartening up its frequently dim-witted assistant Siri to creating customized emojis on the fly. Here's what to expect from the event.
content: It’s that time of the year again, when Apple shows off an all-new iPhone and other products. This time, however, the tech giant has not given away any information. The event, titled 'Glowtime', is expected to launch a new line of phones and tablets, most certainly with generative AI capabilities added.Here's what to expect:New iPhonesAs per the norm, Apple is expected to release the newest version of its flagship smartphone iPhone at the event. With $39 billion in sales last quarter, the iPhone counts for roughly 60 percent of Apple’s revenue, and remains the main entryway to the company’s services, such as the App Store or Apple TV, which are becoming a growing part of its business.The company has a lot riding on what would be the iPhone 16 and will hope that customers will be tempted to buy the latest models. According to a study by TD Securities, people are holding on to their iPhones longer as compelling new features have dwindled. The time between replacing an iPhone has expanded to nearly five years, up from three years in 2018. The slowdown in buying new phones has weighed on Apple's business.
